explanation: '洗衣服' is standard Putonghua; '汰衣裳' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese/Jiangsu) for washing clothes.
'什么时候' is standard Putonghua; '啥辰光' is Shanghainese/Wu dialect for 'when'.
'东西' is standard Putonghua; '物事' is Wu dialect (Jiangsu/Zhejiang) for 'thing/stuff'.
'说话' is standard Putonghua; '讲闲话' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) for chatting or talking.
'漂亮' is standard Putonghua; '标致' meaning 'pretty' is commonly used in Wu dialect regions (Shanghai/Jiangsu).
'吵架' is standard Putonghua; '吵相骂' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) for quarreling.
'害怕' is standard Putonghua; '发慌' meaning scared is commonly used in Wu dialect areas.
'玩' is standard Putonghua; '白相' is a classic Wu dialect (Shanghainese) word for 'to play/to have fun'.
'筷子' is standard Putonghua; '箸' (zhù) is an archaic form preserved in Wu and Min dialects for chopsticks.
'生气' is standard Putonghua; '来三' meaning angry is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) usage.
'晚上' is standard Putonghua; '夜里向' is Wu dialect (Jiangsu/Zhejiang) for evening/night.
'下雨' is standard Putonghua; '落雨' is Wu dialect (and some southern dialects) for raining.
'明天' is standard Putonghua; '明朝' meaning tomorrow is Wu dialect (Shanghainese/Suzhou).
'他' is standard Putonghua; '伊' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) for the third-person pronoun 'he/she'.
'不要' is standard Putonghua; '覅' (fiào) is a Wu dialect contraction of '勿要', meaning 'don't'.
'聪明' is standard Putonghua; '灵光' meaning clever/smart is a Wu dialect expression from Shanghai/Jiangsu.
'女儿' is standard Putonghua; '囡囡' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) for daughter or little girl.
'小气' is standard Putonghua for stingy; '寒酸' meaning stingy/miserly is a Wu dialect regional usage.
'热闹' is standard Putonghua; '闹猛' is a Wu dialect (Shanghainese) expression for lively/bustling.
'里面' is standard Putonghua; '里向' is Wu dialect (Jiangsu/Zhejiang) for 'inside'.
'吃早饭' is standard Putonghua; '吃早' is a Wu dialect abbreviation for eating breakfast.
'厉害' is standard Putonghua; '结棍' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) meaning 'awesome/formidable'.
'开玩笑' is standard Putonghua; '寻开心' is Wu dialect (Shanghainese) for joking around or teasing.
'外面' is standard Putonghua; '外头' is commonly used in Wu dialect and some northern dialect regions for 'outside'.
'回家' is standard Putonghua; '转去' is Wu dialect (Jiangsu) meaning 'to go home/go back'.
'舒服' is standard Putonghua; '巴适' is Sichuan dialect for comfortable/nice.
'做' is standard Putonghua; '整' as a general verb meaning 'to do/make' is Sichuan/Northeastern dialect.
'傻子' is standard Putonghua; '莽子' is Sichuan dialect for a fool/dummy.
'没问题' is standard Putonghua; '没得问题' uses the Sichuan dialectal negative '没得' instead of '没有'.
'非常' is standard Putonghua for 'very'; '恼火' meaning 'very/hard to deal with' is Sichuan dialect.
'吃饭' is standard Putonghua; '吃嘎嘎' is Sichuan dialect baby-talk for eating meat/food.
'看' is standard Putonghua; '瞅' meaning to look/glance is commonly used in Sichuan and northern dialects.
'说大话' is standard Putonghua for bragging; '冲壳子' is Sichuan dialect for boasting/talking big.
'没有' is standard Putonghua; '没得' is Sichuan/southwestern Mandarin for 'don't have'.
'小孩子' is standard Putonghua; '娃儿' is Sichuan/southwestern dialect for child.
'去哪里' is standard Putonghua; '去哪儿' is Beijing/northern colloquial with erhua but widely accepted. In strict PSC contexts, '哪里' is more standard.
'吝啬' is standard Putonghua; '抠门' meaning stingy is Sichuan/northern colloquial.
'膝盖' is standard Putonghua; '磕膝头' is Sichuan dialect for knee.
'厨房' is standard Putonghua; '灶房' is Sichuan/southwestern dialect for kitchen.
'摔倒' is standard Putonghua; '摔跟头' is Sichuan/northern colloquial for falling down.
'一会儿' is standard Putonghua; '一哈儿' is Sichuan dialect for 'a moment/a little while'.
'漂亮' is standard Putonghua; '排场' meaning attractive/beautiful is Sichuan dialect usage.
'聊天' is standard Putonghua; '摆龙门阵' is a famous Sichuan expression for chatting/telling stories.
'拖鞋' is standard Putonghua; '趿拉板儿' is Sichuan/northwestern dialect for slippers.
'开心' is standard Putonghua; '安逸' meaning 'pleasant/comfortable/great' is Sichuan dialect.
'聊天' is standard Putonghua; '唠嗑' is Northeastern dialect for chatting.
'非常' is standard Putonghua; '嘎嘎' meaning 'extremely/very' is Northeastern dialect.
'什么' is standard Putonghua; '啥' is Northeastern/northern dialectal abbreviation for 'what'.
'吓人' is standard Putonghua for scary; '膈应' meaning disgusting or creepy is Northeastern dialect.
'调皮' is standard Putonghua for naughty; '皮实' meaning tough/mischievous is Northeastern dialect.
'能干' is standard Putonghua; '有两下子' meaning capable/skilled is Northeastern colloquial.
'行' is standard Putonghua for 'OK/fine'; '中' meaning OK is Henan/Northeastern dialect.
'吝啬' is standard Putonghua for stingy; '抠' meaning stingy/tight-fisted is Northeastern dialect.
'打架' is standard Putonghua; '干仗' meaning to fight is Northeastern dialect.
'胡说' is standard Putonghua for talking nonsense; '扯犊子' is Northeastern dialect for rambling/nonsense.
'不好' or '脏' is standard Putonghua; '埋汰' meaning dirty/degrading is Northeastern dialect.
'发呆' is standard Putonghua for spacing out; '发苞米' meaning daydreaming is Northeastern humorous dialect.
'摔倒' is standard Putonghua; '出溜' meaning to slip/slide and fall is Northeastern dialect.
'批评' is standard Putonghua for criticize; '削' meaning to scold/beat is Northeastern dialect.
'炫耀' is standard Putonghua; '显摆' meaning to show off is Northeastern dialect.
'吃饭' is standard Putonghua; '造' meaning to eat heartily is Northeastern dialect slang.
'聪明' is standard Putonghua; '机灵' meaning clever/sharp is more commonly used in Northeastern dialect.
'可以' is standard Putonghua; '管' meaning 'sure/OK' is Northeastern dialect usage.
'讨厌' is standard Putonghua; '烦人' used as an interjection meaning 'annoying!' is typical Northeastern dialect style.
'傻' is standard Putonghua; '彪' meaning stupid/crazy is Northeastern dialect.
'找' is standard Putonghua for 'to find/get'; '整' as a general verb for 'do/get/make' is Northeastern dialect.
'房子' is standard Putonghua; '厝' (cuò) is Min dialect (Fujian/Taiwan) for house.
'吃了吗' is standard Putonghua; '吃饱没' is Min dialect (Taiwan/Fujian) greeting style for 'have you eaten'.
'老板' is standard Putonghua; '头家' (thâu-ke) is Hokkien/Min dialect for boss.
'漂亮' is standard Putonghua; '水' (suí) meaning beautiful is Taiwanese Hokkien/Min dialect.
'可怜' is standard Putonghua; '歹命' is Min dialect (Hokkien) for unfortunate/pitiful fate.
'男孩' is standard Putonghua; '查甫' (tsa-poo) is Hokkien/Min dialect for male/man.
'好吃' is standard Putonghua; '好食' is Min dialect (Hokkien) for delicious.
'多少钱' is standard Putonghua; '几块钱' as a general price question is Taiwanese/Min dialect influenced.
'锅' is standard Putonghua; '鼎' meaning cooking pot is Hokkien/Min dialect usage.
'朋友' is standard Putonghua; '牵手' meaning close friend/partner is Hokkien/Min dialect.
'不知道' is standard Putonghua; '不知影' (m̄-tsai-iáⁿ) is Hokkien/Min dialect for 'don't know'.
'下午' is standard Putonghua; '下昼' is Min dialect (Fujian/Teochew) for afternoon.
'走路' is standard Putonghua; '行路' meaning 'to walk' is Min dialect and Cantonese usage.
'谢谢' is standard Putonghua; '多谢' is more commonly used in Cantonese and Min dialect regions.
'什么' is standard Putonghua; '么斯' is Hubei dialect (Wuhan area) for 'what'.
'没有' is standard Putonghua; '冇' (mǎo) is Cantonese/Hunan dialect for 'don't have'.
'怎么' is standard Putonghua; '何解' is Hubei/Hunan dialect for 'why/how come'.
'不知道' is standard Putonghua; '晓不得' is Hubei/Hunan dialect for 'don't know'.
'一起' is standard Putonghua; '一伙' meaning 'together' is Hubei/Hunan dialectal usage.
'很多' is standard Putonghua; '蛮多' uses the Hunan/Wu dialectal intensifier '蛮' instead of standard '很'.
'地方' is standard Putonghua; '场子' meaning 'place' is a Hubei/Hunan dialectal term.
'妻子' is standard Putonghua; '堂客' is Hunan dialect for wife.
'男人' is standard Putonghua; '男将' is Hunan dialect for man/husband.
'吃' is standard Putonghua; '恰' (qiā) meaning 'to eat' is Hunan dialect.
'昨天' is standard Putonghua; '昨日个' is Hubei dialect for yesterday.
'容易' is standard Putonghua; '好搞' meaning 'easy to handle' is colloquial Hubei dialect.
'猪肉' is standard Putonghua; '大肉' is a northwestern/regional dialectal euphemism for pork.
'太阳' is standard Putonghua; '日头' meaning the sun is used in many regional dialects across China.
'打雷' is standard Putonghua; '响雷' is a dialectal variant used in various regions for thunder.
'姑娘' is standard Putonghua; '丫头' is a northern colloquial/dialectal term for girl.
'衣服' is standard Putonghua; '衣裳' is a northern dialectal/classical variant for clothes.
'傍晚' is standard Putonghua; '擦黑' meaning dusk is a northern dialectal expression.
'口袋' is standard Putonghua; '兜兜' meaning pocket is a dialectal/colloquial diminutive used in various regions.
'赶快' is standard Putonghua; '紧到' meaning 'hurry up/quickly' is southwestern dialectal usage.
